alert.note: Alert for Webster (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 03 at 12:47PM EST until March 03 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM CST FOR CRITTENDEN...CALDWELL...TRIGG...SOUTHWESTERN WEBSTER AND LYON COUNTIES... At 1147 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles west of Sturgis to near Eddyville to near Canton, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. These dangerous storms have a long history of wind damage. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Princeton, Marion, Cadiz, Eddyville, Sturgis, Land Between The Lakes Area, Salem, Olney, Cobb, Creswell, Canton, Farmersville, Rockcastle, Kuttawa, Fredonia, Fryer and Dycusburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 35 and 69. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 68 and 87. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for southern Illinois...and western, south central and northwestern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
